This notebook follows along with the following video:   

[R - kNN - k nearest neighbor (part 2) ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DkLNb0CXw84&list=PLjPbBibKHH18I0mDb_H4uP3egypHIsvMn&index=23)

The following code will setup the environment so it is like at the end of part 1 of the kNN technique:

```{r}
data(iris)
set.seed(9850)
invisible(runif(5))                  #must re-run this since we did this before 
gp<-runif(nrow(iris))
iris <- iris[order(gp),]
normalize <- function(X) {
    return ( (X-min(X)) / (max(X)-min(X)) )
}
iris_n <- as.data.frame(lapply(iris[,c(1,2,3,4)], normalize))
```

```{r}
str(iris)
```

```{r}
head(iris)
```

```{r}
iris_train <- iris_n[1:129,]
iris_test <- iris_n[130:150,]
```

```{r}
iris_train_target <- iris[1:129,5]
iris_test_target <- iris[130:150,5]
```

```{r}
require(class)
```

```{r}
sqrt(150)
```

```{r}
m1 <- knn(train=iris_train, test=iris_test, cl=iris_train_target, k=3)
```

```{r}
m1
```

```{r}
table(iris_test_target, m1)
```
